@@ -13,13 +13,14 @@ See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
 limitations under the License.
 ==============================================================================*/
 
-#ifndef TENSORFLOW_CORE_KERNELS_SEGMENT_REDUCTION_OPS_H_
-#define TENSORFLOW_CORE_KERNELS_SEGMENT_REDUCTION_OPS_H_
+#ifndef THIRD_PARTY_TENSORFLOW_CORE_KERNELS_SEGMENT_REDUCTION_OPS_H_
+#define THIRD_PARTY_TENSORFLOW_CORE_KERNELS_SEGMENT_REDUCTION_OPS_H_
 
-#include "third_party/eigen3/unsupported/Eigen/CXX11/Tensor"
+#include <limits>
 #include "tensorflow/core/framework/tensor.h"
 #include "tensorflow/core/framework/tensor_shape.h"
 #include "tensorflow/core/framework/tensor_types.h"
+#include "third_party/eigen3/unsupported/Eigen/CXX11/Tensor"
body: Nit: The Eigen include should usually go first. It doesn't strictly need to here, but many times we've seen bugs because somebody would would set Eigen-related macros after unknowingly including "third_party/eigen3/unsupported/Eigen/CXX11/Tensor" through a transitively include.
body_html: Nit: The Eigen include should usually go first. It doesn't strictly need to here, but many times we've seen bugs because somebody would would set Eigen-related macros after unknowingly including "third_party/eigen3/unsupported/Eigen/CXX11/Tensor" through a transitively include.
body_text: Nit: The Eigen include should usually go first. It doesn't strictly need to here, but many times we've seen bugs because somebody would would set Eigen-related macros after unknowingly including "third_party/eigen3/unsupported/Eigen/CXX11/Tensor" through a transitively include.
